entries.meaning: (chiefly medicine) A failure to function in an expected or complete manner. Usually refers to a disorder in a bodily organ (e.g. erectile dysfunction), a mental disorder, or the improper behavior of a social group.

verbs.description: dysfunction (third-person singular simple present dysfunctions, present participle dysfunctioning, simple past and past participle dysfunctioned)

entries.meaning: (nonstandard, intransitive, chiefly biology) To fail to function correctly; to malfunction.
